pullRequest.body:
Add four lemmas about preservation of sequential compactness under (sequentially) continuous functions. 
[Zulip discussion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/Sequential.20compactness.20under.20sequentially.20cont.20functions/near/449031782)

---

GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10090115593/job/27898861546)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10090115593/job/27898861730)

Thanks! üöÄ

maintainer merge

Thanks! üöÄ

maintainer merge

```suggestion
theorem isSeqCompact_range_of_continuous [SeqCompactSpace X] (f_cont : Continuous f) :
```

```suggestion
  K_cpt.image f_cont.seqContinuous
```

```suggestion
  isSeqCompact_range f_cont.seqContinuous
```

Some variables are already in scope.
```suggestion
variable [TopologicalSpace Y] {f : X ‚Üí Y}
```

Minor golfing suggestion:
```suggestion
  choose xs xs_in_K fxs_eq_ys using ys_in_fK
  obtain ‚ü®a, a_in_K, phi, phi_mono, xs_phi_lim‚ü© := K_cpt xs_in_K
  refine ‚ü®f a, mem_image_of_mem f a_in_K, phi, phi_mono, ?_‚ü©
  exact (f_cont xs_phi_lim).congr fun x ‚Ü¶ fxs_eq_ys (phi x)
```
I don't think that we need `_of_continuous` lemmas. It's easy enough to use `h.image f_cont.seqContinuous`.

Let me comment briefly, since I think I was the one who suggested to @janemms the addition of the spellings with the assumption `Continuous f`.

I of course agree with @urkud that instead of applying `IsSeqCompact.image_of_continuous` or `isSeqCompact_range_of_continuous`, it will be very easy to apply `IsSeqCompact.image` or `isSeqCompact_range` by transforming a continuity hypothesis to a sequential continuity hypothesis with dot notation.

The main reason why I thought that the versions `IsSeqCompact.image_of_continuous` or `isSeqCompact_range_of_continuous` would be useful is discoverability. For example Loogle would not find the main lemma `IsSeqCompact.image` with key words `IsSeqCompact` and `Continuous` (the users would need to generalize the search term to `SeqContinuous` by themselves.) Likewise, `exact?` would not find the lemmas, if the context only has continuity hypothesis (so a user would need to understand to add `have f_seqcont := f_cont.seqContinuous` before the search succeeds). Of course a sharp user will understand that only the general version might exist in Mathlib, but if generalizing the hypothesis does not even occur to the user, this will be easy to miss. The case here is different from cases where the generalized hypotheses are of type class form, since then type class inference in `exact?` would do the appropriate generalization on behalf of the user.

I don't have strong opinions on which choice is better --- just wanted to present also the argument in favor of the choice to include the alternative versions for consideration.

About `loogle`: I would search for `IsSeqCompact (_ '' _)`. About `exact?`: if `f` is given by a formula, then you need something like `continuity` anyway, so `exact?` won't work. Should we ask on Zulip for more opinions?
E.g., we don't add `Continuous` versions of the lemmas assuming `Measurable` or `AEMeasurable`.

To me either choice is fine. And I'm sure if your opinion after hearing the discoverability argument is clear, then that is the right thing to do!

(Regarding your last example, however, I find the existence of both `Measurable` and `AEMeasurable` versions of some lemmas is more analogous to the current `Continuous` and `SeqContinuous` duplication question. I think a user will not be surprised that measurability needs to be derived from continuity explicitly. But a user might not realize they should derive a.e.-measurability from measurability, so having both spellings is good.)

`SeqContinuous` and `IsSeqCompact` are probably going to be rather rare (much more so than `Measurable` and `AEMeasurable`). So I don't think the discoverability difficulties would affect very many users in any case. And I fully trust your judgement and experience about library design principles!
After discussing this with @YaelDillies, I decided to remove the lemmas assuming continuity.

Can you take the opportunity to rename `SeqCompactSpace.seq_compact_univ` to `IsSeqCompact.univ` so that this becomes
```suggestion
  simpa using isSeqCompact_univ.image f_cont
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/Sequences): preservation of sequential compactness under continuous functions
